title: Reducing Assassin damage to Tanks and Juggernauts would improve the over-the-top feel of game damage
body:
Reduce assassin damage to tanks and juggernauts during the early game, the period before they can typically start stacking resistances

Reduce assassin damage to tanks and juggernauts during the late game, the period when assassins start purchasing percent pen on top of their flat pen and rendering resistances obsolete

These two conditions allow for stronger counters to assassins, which would play a role in reducing the current over-the-top feel of game damage.

This would also add a true distinction in the durability of tanks and juggernauts compared to their mobile bruiser brethren {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:164}} who often use the same items.

 the early and mid game times are when assassins are the best, they have to snowball to get a good mid game and a not that shitty late game. In the early game all of the tanks and juggernauts haven’t built a lot of resistances yet. The tank and juggernauts weakest states are usually the early game, at this point the tanks don’t have enough resistances and health to easily survive in all-in’s and juggernauts, on top of the low amount of resistances and health, don’t have their damage items to reliably fight. 
Assassins are supposed to take advantage of this time to snowball and get a lead on their lane opponents, no matter if the enemy laner is a tank, squishy, or juggernaut. The assassin is supposed to use their early game-mid game power and powerspike points to get try and get ahead to win the game. If the assassin can’t do this then he has failed and his/her team will most likely lose.

By nerfing the assassins early game damage (in general or just against tanks/juggernauts) you would unbalance the game and make assassins even more shit. Then assassins would be so bad that juggernauts would again see a ton of play in mid where they can dominate against assassins.
